channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2024100341
item.description:
Report E-2024100341

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0016 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XDP. It was reported that approximately 1/2 gallon of Gold Assassin RTU Concentrated Cleaner Degreaser was released from a 5-gallon plastic jug due to a forklift puncture by XML. The release impacted trailer #3213813. (1) 5-gallon metal drum contains: Gold Assassin RTU Concentrated Cleaner Degreaser.

item.title: Report X-2024100607
item.description:
Report X-2024100607

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the ORDR location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans and the lid of one can came off spilling the contents. While investigating the contents the spill agent determined they were a UN1171. The outer fiberboard box did not have any DG markings or paperwork. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and are being held for the FAA.

item.title: Report E-2024100306
item.description:
Report E-2024100306

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 00:50 EST on 9/19, XPO-XLA contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 cups of "Alum Brite Etching Cleaner" from a 55-gallon poly drum. The drum fell through the faulty pallet and was punctured by a nail. The contractors neutralized the trailer and overpacked the 55-gallon poly drum into (1) 95-gallon metal drum, impacted pads, pallet and cardboard were containerized into (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100224
item.description:
Report E-2024100224

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-10T09:22:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 30, 2024, three (3) 35-gallon jugs of UN1210 were damaged in transit and released approximately give (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+ L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The damaged jugs were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. All spent absorbents were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.
